intro: Dimorphanthes stipulata, commonly known as the stipulate dimorphanthus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and alternate leaves with stipules. Its flowers are typically pink or purple, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and rocky areas.
